intro: Corydalis pseudobalfouriana, commonly known as the Himalayan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
